answers.answer: I have the same problem.  My feet is on fire and it goes up to my thighs.  Spasms and unbearable pain.  I have an appointment to see a vascular surgeon and an neurologist next week.  Still, the medication the doctor gave me is not working.  I'm screaming....but I'm alive.  Gotta remain focus.  It could be worse.Love and ALOHA,Auntie Pupule

question: Hi, I have been diagnosed with peripheral neuropathy  (sp?) and told that there was nothing that could be done.  I have had these symptoms for over 20 yrs. but only recently has it been so bad I needed to find out what it was.  The symptoms are in primarily in my feet but are moving up my legs.  I am taking Lyrica at 150 mg 4 times a day to stop the pain, but now I have been loosing allot of hair and have gained 35 lbs., and am experiencing short term memory loss, which is getting worse.I have tried to reduce the doses but the pain is too unbearable - is this all that I can do?  I really need help.  I have been on these meds for 2 yrs.  Cymbalta was tried but had worse side affects.
title: Neurology and med symptoms
